intro: Pistolochia majori, commonly known as the giant pistolpod, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and has adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are bipinnate, and it produces yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. The seeds are enclosed in thick, leathery pods that can remain on the plant for extended periods.
